meanings.definition: The practice of keeping and breeding birds.
meanings.sent1: Aviculture is a hobby enjoyed by many bird lovers.
meanings.sent2: Aviculture plays a crucial role in preserving endangered bird species.
meanings.sent3: The aviculture club organized a fun bird-watching event.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to aviculture soared as high as the birds she cared for.
meanings.sent5: Learning about aviculture opened up a whole new world of feathered friends.

meanings.definition: The business of raising birds for sale.
meanings.sent1: Aviculture can be a profitable venture for those with a passion for birds.
meanings.sent2: The local market thrived due to the demand for aviculture products.
meanings.sent3: The entrepreneur's aviculture business took flight in the market.
meanings.sent4: In the world of aviculture, every bird has a value beyond just money.
meanings.sent5: The success of her aviculture enterprise spread far and wide.

meanings.sent1: Aviculture involves learning about the proper care and nutrition for birds.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a specialized course in aviculture for aspiring bird experts.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for aviculture was evident in every lecture.
meanings.sent4: Through aviculture studies, she gained a deep understanding of bird behavior.
meanings.sent5: His aviculture research shed light on new ways to improve bird welfare.
